title: I feel that thematically, as a ninja, Shen should have invisibilty for 3 seconds after ultimate.
body:
Also, after ultimate, he will get bonus % health true damage on his passive.

I feel like this will promote counterplay.

replies.body:
Also, while stealthed by ultimate (which is, of course, true stealth), his passive will have no cooldown, so as to promote using his ultimate offensively. Also, his passive is boring, so passive attacks will not remove him from stealth. This is to promote strong teamwork with Alkali, whose shroud is changing to a global and toggle for these Shen changes.

This package of changes should further promote the counterplay of Pink Warding Kennen's Slicing Maelstrom.

Alkali? Is that a new champion?
Is she countered by acids?

Damnit, autocorrect... Whatever, I'm leaving it.

We're now reworking Akali to Alkali, the Basic Ninja. 5000000000000000 is leading her design after promising to add acidity level to Cassiopeia's spells as a countermeasure to Alkali's acids. However, because the role of ordinary ninja was already occupied in League of Legends, 5000000000000000 stuck too close to the thematic virtues of a ninja and somehow managed to make her so stealthy she disappeared from the client and all champion selects altogether. Thankfully, she still shows up in Death Recaps occasionally to remind us of his hard work on her.

Wait wait wait.

If Alkali's getting acids, shouldn't the proper countermeasure be to give a champion bases?  We'd just be adding more acidity to Alkali's acids by having other champs get acidity.

Acid acidity acidity acid acid acid acid acidity acid acidity acid acid.

No no no.

Per grand designer 5000000000000000, Alkali is _countered_ by acids, and therefore, must be the basic ninja.
But then if you gave the basic ninja acids, then wouldn't that mean that Alkali does basically everything whereas other champs do only one thing?
In this case, Alkali would do H2O things
Pool Party {{champion:84}}  confirmed?
I have no idea how we got here but I approve!

When you mix an acid and a base, the H+ and OH- ions (respectively) combine to form water, which is found in a pool, and since the joke was about Akali, pool-party Akali.

I think I just killed the joke.
but if basic alkali gets countered by acids, wouldn't that bring salty behaviour?
But where's the third hit proc?
Your personality is on drugs and I love you.
